name: bathroom
longDescription: You're in the Bathroom. It's a cramped, dank room. The sink is dripping, but you can barely hear it over the storm outside. On the west wall, there is a small window next to the claw foot tub. There's a medicine cabinet above the sink, and a towel hanging next to the door. The floor is covered in tile, the walls in dark floral wallpaper. The door back to the Upper Hall is to the east.
shortDescription: You're in the Bathroom. The sink is quietly dripping. There's a window, tub, medicine cabinet, and towel in the room. The door to the Upper Hall is east.

cabinet.0: There's a medicine cabinet above the sink.
cabinet.1: There's a medicine cabinet, containing some bandages and a pill bottle.

Examine.tub: You inspect the tub, looking for anything that might be out of place. It desperately needs cleaning, but there is nothing unusual here.
Examine.window: It's very small, only meant for ventilation.
Examine.cabinet: It's a shallow box on the wall, clearly more modern than the rest of the bathroom furnishing. The door has a mirror on it, and you catch a glance at yourself. You look pale... and tired. It's been a long day, and looks like it will be a long night, too.
Examine.bandages: Some cheap bandages. You hope you won't need them.
Examine.pills: It's your prescription for anxiety medication. Lot of good it's doing for you right now...
Examine.towel: It's a red hand towel with an embroidered trim.
Examine.sink: The brass-colored faucet is dripping quietly.
Examine.walls: The wallpaper looks old, but you kinda like it.
Examine.floor: The floor tiles are in a black and white checker pattern.
Examine.ceiling: It's white and covered in a popcorn texture.
Examine.toilet: It's just a white porcelain toilet.

Eat.pills: You hesitate and consider it for a moment... But you've already taken your daily dose.

Use.pills: You hesitate and consider it for a moment... But you've already taken your daily dose.
Use.bandages: You don't need that right now.

Hide.tub: For a moment, you consider stepping into the tub, but you decide against it.

Listen.sink: It keeps dripping, even with the faucet turned off.

Open.pills: You don't need to do that.
Open.window: You don't need to do that. There's probably enough dampness and mold in here already.
Open.cabinet: The cabinet creaks as you swing the door open. Thereâ€™s a box of bandages and a bottle of medicine inside.

Flip.bandages: They're just simple bandages. They're simple to use.
Flip.switch: The light isn't working in here either.
Flip.pills: You have had this prescription for years, but just now notice that the side effects of this medicine include 'seeing or hearing things that others do not see or hear'... You chuckle to yourself. Maybe you ARE imagining things...

Shake.pills: You rattle the pills around in the bottle.
Shake.towel: You shake the towel. Nothing happens.
Shake.bandages: The bandages slide around in the box.

Take.bandages: You don't need those right now.
Take.towel: You don't need that right now.
